author: blair
msg: For an upcoming patch to refactor svn's command line processing code
into a separate module that other programs can use, such as svnadmin
This adds a new Python test that runs svn with various command line
options and compares svn's standard output and standard error with
directory.  The expected standard output and standard error are stored
Care is taken to delete or perform search and replace on output that
may differ between builds.  Right now lines containing the regex's
are deleted before the comparison.  I left the line containing
"handles http schema" assuming that everybody has svn with a HTTP
client.  The version number in 'svn --version' is replaced with a
Naming convention for golden files: take the svn command line as a
single string and apply the following sed transformations:
Then append either _stdout or _stderr for the file descriptor to
implementation of this test.  Based off of the other *.py tests in this
New golden file containing the output of svn with some command line

author: sussman
msg: Make the path@rev syntax available to any subcommand that wants it.
Right now, the only subcommands that use it are diff and merge.
[ Folks who are discussing the correctness of this "@" syntax: feel
free to toy with alteratives, I'm pretty indifferent.  The function
* util.c (parse_path): re-add here, as a helper args_to_target_array.
which is called by every svn_cl__foo_subcommand, now has the
optional ability to strip @rev syntax from paths and write the
* cl.h (svn_cl__args_to_target_array): take a new boolean flag.

author: cmpilato
msg: (svn_cl__merge): Clean up some warning-causing unused variables.

author: sussman
msg: Make client application parse 'svn merge' args correctly.  This is just a
first run.  Karl suggests that we extend the "PATH@REV" syntax to
*all* subcommands that can use it (diff, copy, etc.)  That will be my
* main.c (svn_cl__cmd_table): rewrite help-description of merge interface.
static, because merge-cmd.c:parse_path needs this functionality.
* merge-cmd.c (svn_cl__merge): total rewrite of merge argument parsing.
(parse_path):  helper function to parse the "@" syntax in merge sources.

author: cmpilato
msg: More commit-related cleaning up and stuff.
Store the temporary file paths created by svn_wc_transmit_*_deltas.
